results.abstract: An outsider herself as a young woman, the director and actress wants teenage girls to relish a sense of community.
What’s more fundamental to scary movies than the bone-chilling shriek? But delivering a terrifying wail isn’t easy. It’s an entire art with a history and a world of its own.
results.title: They Scream! We Scream!

results.title: Stream These Vintage Heist Movies
results.abstract: Some of the most popular heist films of the last 25 years are remakes of beloved classics. Here’s where you can get away with streaming the originals, plus some other vintage-cool crooks.

results.title: Sean Connery, Who Embodied James Bond and More, Dies at 90
results.abstract: To legions of fans who have watched a parade of actors play Agent 007, none played the part as magnetically or as indelibly as Mr. Connery.

results.title: How New York’s Small Cinemas Are Hanging On
results.abstract: Despite the continued shutdown of the city’s movie houses, indie theaters just may survive: They are less reliant on Hollywood and have a loyal audience.

multimedia.copyright: Calla Kessler for The New York Times
multimedia.caption: Nick Nicolaou, who owns Cinema Village, and the people behind indie cinemas like Film Forum, Anthology Film Archives and Nitehawk remain in an uneasy limbo, desperate for audiences yet terrified of cinemas becoming petri dishes.
